title: 112_hr1935
content: The "Supply Our Soldiers Act of 2011" is a legislation that establishes a Postal Benefits Program for members of the Armed Forces. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the United States Postal Service, will establish a program to provide postal benefits to qualified individuals who are members of the Armed Forces on active duty in Iraq or Afghanistan or hospitalized due to a service-related disease or injury. The postal benefits provided under this Act consist of vouchers entitling qualified individuals to make free postage mailings. A qualified mailing is a single mail piece sent from a US post office area to a qualified individual. The Act provides vouchers for free postage mailings to qualified individuals. The mail described includes first-class mail and parcel post within specified weight limits. Each individual is eligible for one voucher per month for a qualified mailing. Vouchers cannot be used for more than one mailing or after the expiration date set by the Secretary of Defense. Coordination rules apply to postal benefits under this Act. The Act provides vouchers for free postage mailings to qualified individuals, including first-class mail and parcel post within weight limits. Coordination rules apply to postal benefits under this Act, which are in addition to any reduced postage rates available by law. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the Postal Service, will prescribe regulations within 30 days of the Act's enactment for voucher distribution and compliance procedures. SEC. 3. FUNDING. The Department of Defense is authorized to appropriate funds for providing benefits for fiscal years 2012 through 2017, not to exceed $75 million. The Department shall transfer an amount to the Postal Service in advance of each quarter for postal benefits under this Act. The Department of Defense will make quarterly adjustments to postal benefits based on previous determinations. Annual corrections will be made for fiscal years 2012 through 2016, with transfers between the Postal Service and the Department of Defense. Final determinations will be made for each quarter. Final determinations for correcting previous determinations under this section must be made within 6 months after the end of fiscal year 2017. The Department of Defense, in consultation with the Postal Service, will make estimates and determinations of postal benefits under this Act. The postal benefits under this Act will be applicable to mail sent from October 1, 2011, to September 30, 2017.
